page.title: 10LAND USE IN TIBBERTON
page.content: The farms used to rear{livestock, sheep, pigs, and cattle; but many changes have taken place, and now they concentrate mainly on{arable farming;} growing winter cereals, winter wheat, winter barley, spring barley, oil-seed rape, potatoes, sugar beet and peas. The land is very fertile and is able to grow most crops. The soil is fairly light and needs irrigation to get its full potential. The farms do not have many animals, so have to make use of{fertilizer.}The main type used is seaweed{fertilizer,} which is more natural than others. Crop rotation is also used. The largest field in Tibberton is about 40 acres, which is much less than fields in the east. Several scrub hedges have been removed.{ Tibberton Grange owns tied cottages for farm worker.
